derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tang(e) (singular), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tang and German Zange

entry.def: Tongs are a tool that you use to grip and pick up objects that you do not want to touch. They consist of two long narrow pieces of metal joined together at one end.

example.ex: The waiter lifted rolls from a basket with a pair of silver tongs.
example.tran: 侍者用一把银钳从篮子里夹起面包卷。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various devices for taking hold of objects; usually have two hinged legs with handles above and pointed hooks below
